---
title: Data wrangling
format:

  ipynb: default
code-annotations: below
---

Introduction to pandas and tabular data analysis. No spatial so far.

- read_csv
- head, tail, info, describe, Transpose
- min, max, slicing
- add and remove columns
- indexing
- queries
- sorting
- plotting
- groupby

::: {#c67b2355 .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd # <1>
```
:::


1. Import the `pandas` package under the shortcut `pd`.

Describe the data

::: {#2ab25cb4 .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
chicago_1918 = pd.read_csv(             # <1>
    "data/chicago_influenza_1918.csv",  # <2>
    index_col="geography_code",         # <3>
)
```
:::


1. Use the `read_csv` function from `pandas`.
2. Specify the path to the file
3. Use the column `geography_code` as an index of the DataFrame. More on that below.
